title: Pizza Express hires advisers amid mounting debt fears
text:
Pizza Express has hired advisers for help as it prepares to hold crunch talks with creditors over its spiralling debt mountain.

The chain, which has around 14,000 employees and more than 600 sites worldwide, is understood to have brought on board restructuring experts Houlihan Lokey to discuss options as it battles with a slowdown on the High Street.

There is mounting speculation the firm could shut stores or seek a deal with landlords to slash its rental bills as it fights to save money.

It came as the cost of insuring Pizza Express’s debt against default rocketed amid concerns among bondholders over its borrowing.
